attributes.action: A legal requirement for ministers to have worked in the industry they represent
attributes.background: This country needs ministers who have worked in their industries as we have a health secretary who has never worked in the NHS or any medical environment, an education secretary who has never worked in a school or OFSTED...
attributes.additional_details:
We also have a chancellor of the exchequer who has never worked in finance, a justice secretary and former education secretary who has never worked in a courthouse nor a school, and this list goes on

We need ministers who have a deep understanding of the industries they represent, they have their own profession in their interests

So we are calling for a legal requirement of ministers to have worked in their respective industries for at least 5 - 10 years prior to appointment as their minister

attributes.action: Force food outlets to display a Capital H sign if they use Halal meat.
attributes.background:
Many food outlets are using and selling us Halal meat without our knowledge.
This meat has come from the barbaric practice of slitting the the animals throat without stunning them first. They are hung upside down and left to bleed to death. You deserve the right to know what you are eating.
attributes.additional_details: You should be able to clearly see if a food outlet is using Halal meat. You should be able to make an educated choice before buying.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to make GCSE and A levels 100% exam based.
attributes.background:
The government has reintroduced the antiquated and flawed 100% exam based GCSE and A levels.
Teachers don't want it, students don't want it and employers do not want it. Yet the policy has been bullied through with no democratic process.

attributes.action: Get Chiropractors working in the NHS
attributes.background: Due to the pain management dept within the NHS being so stretched its about time chiropractors were brought in to sort the problem out and get the waiting list down, because they can.
attributes.additional_details: I've had a bad back for 24 years.It took 14 years to be diagnosed and i was told that nothing could be done apart from injections for the pain. The waiting list on the NHS was so long that i lost my job. I recently saw a chiropractor who was very optimistic about helping my problem so i decided to give it a go, and i can't believe that after 5 visits i am beginning to feel an improvement,chiropractors need to be enlisted because they can do so much to help bad backs & help the NHS waiting list

attributes.action: Gov help & support, especially in the workplace & schools, for the mentally ill
attributes.background: There's not enough help in the workplace to support sufferers. They need to be better understood and have more help available to them. Things need to be enforced when these people are low, instead of them losing their jobs. More campaigns, awareness, support and lessons explaining it.
attributes.additional_details:
From a fellow sufferer, activist, community development organiser and author.
Shouldn't suffer in silence. Shouldn't feel ashamed. Shouldn't be scared to lose their jobs or fall back in education.

attributes.action: Pass legislation enabling families to take in unaccompanied refugee children.
attributes.background:
Families were encouraged to rescue children during WW2 via the kinder transport program.

Unfortunately we live in a different era, and legisition as it exists would not allow this to happen even if it was a formal program.
attributes.additional_details: The Kindertransport was an organised rescue effort that took place during the nine months prior to the outbreak of the Second World War. The United Kingdom took in nearly 10,000 predominantly Jewish children from Germany, Austria, Czechoslovakia, Poland, and the Free City of Danzig. The children were placed in British foster homes, hostels, schools and farms. Often they were the only members of their families who survived the Holocaust.

attributes.action: Recognise Israel's atrocities against Palestinians and take action to stop it.
attributes.background:
Israel continues to breach the human rights of Palestinians in its illegal occupation of the West Bank  and Gaza. 

I, as a UK citizen petition the UK Government to take action to isolate Israel in the international community until it changes its course and ends its apartheid against Palestinians.
attributes.additional_details:
The action should include:

1. Draft a fresh UN resolution. 
2. Impose full sanctions against Israel
3. Stop selling arms.
4. Proscribe the IDF as a weapon of terror. 
5. Require a plebiscite open to all residents (including refugees) to vote for either a 1 State solution where everyone has 100% equal rights or for a 2 State solution where both States are recognised and have all the comensurate rights and responsibilities of nationhood. 
6. Establish a legal process to compensate Palestinians.

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: To stop fining and criminalising people that are homeless/sleeping rough.
attributes.background: Homeless people are homeless for a reason. We should provide support for them rather than fining them large amounts of money which they evidently in most cases do not have.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish in the UK. It is cruel and unnecessary
attributes.background: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish. Fish are beautiful in their own right. Injecting them with dye is cruel and unnecessary. It is illegal to dye them yourself in the UK but not to import them. The fish suffer and it shortens their life span.

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: ALL coffee, tea , cocoa, chocolate sold in UK to be Fair Trade certified.
attributes.background: Free of EU Trade Restrictions - this petition calls for legislation to end Slavery in the tea, coffee and cocoa farming industries. It calls upon the Government to pass a law requiring ALL tea and coffee and cocoa (chocolate) sold in the UK to be Fair Trade (or Rainforest Alliance) Certified.
attributes.additional_details:
Ask yourself: Is it right that tea that is sold in the UK may be picked by people in bonded labour who have to live amongst their own sewage? Is it fair that the chocolate you buy as an after-school treat for your children contains cocoa picked by a farmer who can’t afford to send her own children to school?

I have dreamt for many years that Britain would one day act to end modern Slavery. Such a law will demonstrate that the UK is outward looking and compassionate, and truly define a new era!

attributes.action: Call a second EU Referendum based on independently verified Facts.
attributes.background: Based on the realization that significantly misleading and inaccurate misinformation and untruths have been officially used and admitted to influence the EU referendum. We demand the first referendum be declared void and a second and final referendum be held considering the following:-
attributes.additional_details:
•One communication be compiled and sent out to all the population containing the same agreed number of pages for each party.
•Each party be limited to three sections to complete along the lines of the following:
1. THE FACTS – These must be independently verified.
2. ASPIRATIONS 
3. A CLEAR REALISTIC PLAN OF HOW THESE ASPIRATIONS WILL BE ACHIEVED. 	
Illustrations limited to statistical and information that they contain independently verified.
We demand proven facts, not deception.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on London becoming independent from the UK
attributes.background:
London is the world's capital. 300+ languages are spoken here. Immigrants are welcome, and are vital to our economy.

We voted decisively to stay in the EU. Our global outlook sets us apart from the rest of England.

London's population is 8.5m – Scotland's is 5.3m.

Independence makes sense.
attributes.additional_details: Specifics: If you live within the M25, you get a vote – just like in the Scottish referendum. It doesn't matter if you're a British citizen or not. If you don't live within the M25, you don't get a vote.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action: Stop permission to build Branston Road School Academy on current proposed site
attributes.background: Vital arable land will be lost. Hedgerow vital to wildlife will be destroyed. Applicant, Planning Authority & Education Authority are one and the same! Surrounding villages were promised green barrier and then this was permitted! Villages not designed to cope with current traffic without school.
attributes.additional_details: Tatenhill Parish Councillors can be contacted for further info.  Burton Mail also has articles referencing objections.

attributes.action: Change the law on eligibility to stand for elected local government posts
attributes.background: Make it unlawful to hold 2 elected posts within local government simultaneously. Make it unlawful for 2 members of the same household (eg spouses) to hold simultaneous posts within the same County council or District within that county.
attributes.additional_details: Recent elections for Police and Crime Commissioner in Warwickshire resulted in the candidate elected being the spouse of the Leader of Warwickshire County Council. The leader of Stratford upon Avon District council also holds a position on Warwickshire County Council. Other councillors hold positions on both District and County Councils. It is hard to envisage how these dual roles and close relationships can not lead to undemocratic influences, whether knowingly or unwittingly.

attributes.action: Different exams for private and state educated pupils
attributes.background: Privately educated children should sit different GCSE and A Level exams to children from state schools. This is because the quality of education for children who's parents are paying over £15k a year will undoubtedly be very different to a student attending the local state school.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing this to happen, the government is not doing enough to close the gap between the rich and the poor. Every year, 5 top independent schools send over 2000 pupils to Oxbridge between them. These kids have almost definitely performed well on the same exams as your sons and daughters whilst driving up the grade boundaries and making it harder to achieve top grades to apply to top universities. How can a child who did not pay for their education be expected to compete with children who did?

attributes.action: Strict penalties for internet providers who fail to prevent repeat IP theft.
attributes.background:
Laws exist to protect Intellectual Property but means to enforce it can be financially unviable. Justice for all, irrelevant of budget. 

Greater penalties to service providers (SPs) failing to prevent repeat infringements & ban SPs from retaining IP unless solely to prevent repeat infringements.
attributes.additional_details:
Safe harbour is abused by SPs allowing repeat infringements and not banning all reported infringers. Sanctions to be made. Enact true Take Down - Stay Down! Technology exists to enact it but is not being utilised.

IPO & PIPCU to conduct an investigation into persistent offender Amazon, it's practices & take-down process.

Protect consumers from inferior & potentially dangerous products.

Make available funding for media campaigns to raise awareness of costs to IP owners and consumers.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for legalising and decriminalising marijuana
attributes.background: Due to the current laws millions are dying and suffering when medical marijuana will help-stop this! Create jobs and and be a huge boost to the economy, health and productivity of our country it is wrong to be outlawed!

attributes.action: Give police the powers to enforce immediate punishments to noisy neighbours
attributes.background: On two occasions now, my family have been victim to noisy neighbours, playing music and shouting throughout the night. The severity of this needs to be addressed and police need to be given powers to immediately seize equipment or enforce other methods to give the victim some respite.
attributes.additional_details: Action needs to be taken on this issue as individuals do become suicidal due to the lack of support from authorities and police. It is not widely documented how much of an effect anti-social and noisy neighbours can have on people. While environmental services can investigate the issue, this can take a long time and people get desperate. The police need powers to tackle the situation right there and then. If their music is too loud, seize the equipment instantly. Harassment, take them into custody.

attributes.action: Charge 20p per prescription item for those who are normally exempt to stop waste
attributes.background: 20p per prescription item will encourage people to check their medication stock before reordering everything. 20p charge will also prevent pharmacies from fraudulently ordering everything for their patients. Multi millions could be saved and used for treatment we currently can not afford.
attributes.additional_details: SAVE our NHS. 20p per item will not be unaffordable for the vast majority. MILLIONS of pounds will be saved!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all energy drinks to under 18's
attributes.background: My14 year old son came home with an energy drink today and it has sent him absolutely manic. Today I saw the high physical/ psychological effects. Children cannot make informed decisions about these drinks.
attributes.additional_details:
>I feel these drinks should not be sold to under 18's.
>Energy drinks could cause public health problems(WHO)
>(eg Red Bull and Monster) contain high levels of caffeine
> increasingly popular, especially with young people.
>health risks related-energy drinks. 
>concerns raised both by scientific community and general public about the health effects of these drinks.
>researchers: potential health risks associated with the high caffeine content
>long-term research/policy action needed (NHS, 2016)

attributes.action: All busses to give change by law.
attributes.background:
This is exactly as it sounds.

I want it to be made law that all busses have to give you chance when paying for your ticket.

Currently some buses do and some do not but the large majority of buses on their timetable says "no change given"
attributes.additional_details: Obviously this would be "within reason" for example I wouldn't want them having to issue change for a £50 note as this would be unreasonable but I would expect change given for up to a £10 note as this is the lowest you can get from an ATM.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: Allow cystic fibrosis patients decide when they are ready for a lung transplant
attributes.background: My brother in law needs a lung transplant as he suffers from cystic fibrosis, he has been in hospital for most of this year when he gets out he is back in within 12 days he is only 22 his lung function is around 30% and his consultant says he cant have a lung transplant yet should be his choice
attributes.additional_details: Every human being should have a good quality of life,  why should 1000s of people die every year not just with cystic fibrosis but everyone who needs an organ transplant? Most people die as a result of being placed on the transplant list to late, My brother in law who needs a lung transplant does not take life for granted he does not drink, smoke or take drugs he shows courage and determination all the time people like him are an inspiration for us all let it be his choice

attributes.action: Change all current motorcycle licensing laws.
attributes.background: The current Motorcycle licensing laws are dangerous for young riders and deter them from progressing to a higher licence. The 28MPH limit on 50cc's is extremely dangerous especially on duel carriageways. The A1 licence should be 250/300cc for motorway use, 125cc's are treacherous for motorway use.
attributes.additional_details:
Things that need to change:
1-	Remove the 28MPH limit on 50cc scooters, they are very dangerous. Most people de-restrict them anyway.
2-	Change the following classes 125cc Lerner rider; 250/300cc A1 rider; 600+cc A unrestricted rider
3-	Allow A1 upgrade system after 2 years of holding the A1 license.
4-	Change CBT to include some theory
5-	Lower the cost of tests as failing is up to £75 down the drain
6-	Make more test times available for around 5PM to 7PM Mon to fri and weekends if possible.

attributes.action: Stop the HMRC phone number being a premium rate and make it free.
attributes.background:
This number is mainly used by people on a low income, elderly people on pensions and those that are registered disabled.
It's charging the people that are less fortunate and really can't afford it.
And average call to the tax office I have found has been 30minutes minimum

attributes.action: Legislation to curb newspapers from knowingly printing factual inaccuracies.
attributes.background: Given the major complaint during the EU referendum was one of factual inaccuracies there should be a way to hold newspapers to account without limiting freedom of the press. If a lie is told on the front page the apology/correction should also be on the front page thus making them more accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The press in the UK is currently beyond reproach. It can print a headline that is totally untrue and currently only be forced to print a small correction where most will not see it. 
Recognising the freedom of the press is sacrosanct we must act to ensure they are accountable in a way that does not impinge upon this. Forcing them to give equal space to which the falsehood was printed under regulation by an independent body would help deter them from knowingly printing lies for political gain.

attributes.action: Waive all fees for EU citizens applying for permanent residency or citizenship
attributes.background: The outcome of the EU referendum means that many EU citizens will be liable for fees amounting to several thousand pounds in order to secure their right to stay in the country.  It would be a great injustice given that they had no right to vote in this referendum.

attributes.action: We should have a referendum to quit NATO and save us from starting a major war.
attributes.background: NATO is not big enough to win a war against Russia, but large enough to start a world war.  This makes it a waste of tax payers money.  NATO has broken its agreement to expand beyond Germany, causing unease with Russia and making us impose US led sanctions, which have made UK farmers suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/601058/Britain-European-Union-Russia-Foreign-Policy-Agriculture-Farmers-Dairy-Phil-Hogan-Milk

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/french-farmers-block-roads-in-protest-at-huge-drop-in-milk-and-pork-prices-following-russian-trade-a6875581.html

http://www.southeastfarmer.net/section/news/eu-sanctions-hit-uk-fruit-growers

attributes.action: Independence referendum for N. Ireland and Scotland
attributes.background: There is a great divide between England, N. Ireland and Scotland because Scotland and N. Ireland both had majority remain but were dragged to leave the EU, we need more democracy, if they want to stay, let them, don't force them
attributes.additional_details: They all voted remain, so they should get what they want rather than being forced by another constitution that a lot of Scottish and N. Irish people want to leave. As we are the British, we pride our selves on being democratic so we must respect their decision even though we might not agree with it like when Germany, France and USA respected our decision when we voted Brexit.

attributes.action: figures/statistics quoted in political campaigns should be official&independent
attributes.background:
Regardless of ones politics, bogus financial/figures and claims are put forward.

To restore faith in politics and so people can make an informed decision, all facts/statistics should be from a central source, who verify statistics for use.

Deviation from this should be made an offence.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: Call a general election in the next 90 days as a result of the EU vote.
attributes.background: This vote should never have been called and as a result the population of the United Kingdom has no confidence in the leadership of the government. We demand a general election in the next 90 days to elect new leaders to help manage this emerging crisis.

attributes.action: Stop housing associations putting registered sex offenders in their properties.
attributes.background: Recently quite a number of registered sex offenders have been allowed to reside in properties owned by a housing association. Two within yards of each other. The area the properties are in is heavily populated by children, also up the road from a school.
attributes.additional_details: One of the offenders moved a few months ago, and since reoffended and been given a custodial sentence. The other is still in residence. There was another offender who owned his property, who reoffended and has since left the area. These are the registered sex offenders we are aware of, no doubt there will be more. Our concern is allowing registered sex offenders to live in an area like this, is a recipe for disaster. We have our children to think about.

attributes.action: Stop British Government discriminating against people with Disabilities
attributes.background: Cody has been on ancestral visa, he has now applied for indefinite leave to remain. Part of this application is a life in the UK test and an English test. Cody has documentary proof that he suffers from severe Dyslexia and Specific Language Impairment. The Government has denied him an excemption.
attributes.additional_details: Under their own rules he should have been granted an exception. Cody has now been refused indefinite leave to remain due to not sitting the test. This is a blatant discriminatory act against people with Disabilities. Under the UK Disabilities Act of 2010. Please support this petition otherwise this means deportation where he has no family or friends with no means of support.

attributes.action: Restore Capital punishment for terrorists & killers of our police & Armed Forces
attributes.background:
Capital Punishment was abolished in 1969.
and for treason was abolished in 1998
With the ever increasing global threat from terrorism, now is the time to restore Capital punishment
Those who seek to murder by terrorism or kill our armed forces and police should pay the ultimate price
attributes.additional_details:
With the heinous murder of Lee Rigby by terrorists, it showed how great the threat to our country really was.
Those who would seek to murder our citizens, Armed Forces and police should face the ultimate sanction.
Furthermore, there is now a fresh threat to our shores from Irish terrorists.
It is time that Capital punishment for the offences of terrorism, murder of Armed Forces and police was brought back on to the statute books.
The evil cowards who cause death and destruction deserve no less

attributes.action: Make career advisers a mandatory requirement in sixth form colleges
attributes.background: Between the ages of 16 and 18 you are expected to know what you want to do with your life after your time at college, but as a hormonal confused teenager, you can easily make a detrimental decision that effects your chances of being happy with your educational and career outcome in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Many teenagers apply to university even though they have no idea what they want to study or whether they even want to go, but they still apply because their teachers and mentors expect them to. Unexplained to 16 to 18 year olds, there are many more options than university in this country and I believe that if there was a career adviser in every sixth form college to talk to students about them, they would choose their next step after higher education with a clearer goal in mind.

attributes.action: Give teachers correct training on peer exclusion
attributes.background: Kids are social creatures, and they need to be in relationships to feel right. Isolating involves cutting someone off from essential relationships. Some kids are pushed into a social ‘no man's land’ by the exclusionary efforts of their peers.
attributes.additional_details: This isolation is itself a problem, as its victims can easily become disconnected. Most of us can identify with the hurt, anger, pain, and bewilderment that anyone might feel in a situation (of social exclusion).Imagine the impact, then, on a child whose whole universe revolves around acceptance, friendships, and the need for support from peers. It is devastating.This is an invisible form of bully and hard to prove but has a massive impact on children of all ages, teacher need to know the signs!

attributes.action: Child Maintenance should not be payable whilst a custody battle is ongoing
attributes.background: Where there is no evidence of domestic violence, child abduction, sexual, drug or alcohol abuse & the resident parent is withholding access from the other parent, Child Maintenance should not be awarded to the resident parent until the courts have ruled otherwise.
attributes.additional_details: Some resident parents use the child as a bargaining chip, robbing the child of a chance to know both parents. The courts can take many months to make a decision. Meanwhile, the non-resident parent pays thousands of pounds to perpetuate the injustice of not seeing the child. Where there is no evidence of abuse or evidence to support risk of abduction, the non-resident parent should not be paying thousands while not allowed contact with the child.

attributes.action: Make consumer debt statute barred after 4 not 6 years.
attributes.background: Currently, creditors can sue for repayment of debts for up to 6 yrs after default or payment. The Courts are overwhelmed. In 2014, there were 1.5 million claims issued and 410,000 judgments with 54 weeks from claim to hearing. By reducing the statute bar to 4 years, this would reduce the claims.
attributes.additional_details: Of £470 bn of consumer debt, £50 billion is now owned by debt purchase companies, who buy bank and credit card balances for 2-10% of their value and then use the Courts to get 100% repayment, making super profits in the process. One company owns £17bn of consumer debt and reported a profit of £196 million last year.By reducing the statute bar to four years, the number of claims would be reduced, the Courts could cope better, and original lenders would be OK. Consumers would be the winners

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to lock toilets during lesson times and break times
attributes.background: My daughters and other children at school are forced to wait up to 20 minutes for someone to come and unlock the school toilets - this is not right. There are children with bladder difficulties and girls who need toilet access. Do you think it's appropriate to have them locked? I certainly do not.

attributes.action: Discuss imposing restrictions on new driving license holders
attributes.background:
Data on British drivers shows that:

Drivers aged 16-19 are a third more likely to die in a crash than drivers aged 40-49.
One in four 18-24 year olds (23%) crash within two years of passing their driving test.
Young male drivers are involved in many more crashes than young female drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Restrictions within the first year of driving would help to decrease new and young driver incidents.

Suggestions previously discussed by the government include having to log 120 hours of supervised practice, including 20 hours at night, being banned from carrying passengers aged under 30 or from driving between the hours of 10pm and 5am unless they are accompanied by an adult aged over 30.

attributes.action: For Jeremy Hunt to spend a day working on an NHS mental Health ward
attributes.background: Since this Goverment has been in power Mental health services funding has declined year on year and Mental health issues in the population are rising and staffing levels in hospitals are at breaking point. Jeremy Hunt  does not have any idea of the real world of Mental Health.
